description: The cf-mitigated header appears in Cloudflare responses when a request triggers one of Cloudflare's security mitigations. The value describes the action taken, such as presenting a challenge or blocking the request.

response-directives.description: Cloudflare challenged the client, usually with a CAPTCHA or JavaScript challenge.
Cloudflare issued a managed challenge that the client needed to solve before continuing.
The request was blocked due to firewall or DDoS protections.
Indicates that a mitigation would have been applied but Cloudflare was running in simulation mode.
